intro: Gilia inconspicua var. tweedyi, commonly known as Tweedy's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or red in color. It has hairy stems and leaves, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
